newsitem.title: USA: Transaction Systems June 30 backlog rises.
newsitem.headline: Transaction Systems June 30 backlog rises.

text.p: Transaction Systems Architects Inc said Thursday its backlog as of June 30 increased by 34 percent or $33 million compared with the previous year.

Backlog at June 30 was $129 million, including $41 million in non-recurring revenue and $88 million in recurring revenue. Non-recurring are fees specified in software and services contracts expected to be recognized in the next 12 months, while recurring are all montly license, maintenance and facilities management fees the company expects over the next 12 months.

Transaction Systems reported operating income of $9.7 million versus $6.04 million last year. On a proforma basis, excluding acquisition-related charges of about $800,000, operating income for second quarter 1996 was $6.9 million.
The company reported second quarter 1997 net income of $6.3 million or $0.22 a share versus $3.9 million or $0.14 a share. Proforma, second quarter 1996 net was $4.4 million or $0.15 a share.
